column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column3: We loved our room .. Was beyond our expectations, the view was excellent. The green and everything. Our overall stay was excellent. I would recommend this accomodation.

column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column4: Very small room, noise made by the castle front door every time someone is using it

column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column3: The surroundings and the classic styles.
column4: I didn't like housekeeping on my door at 9AM. The roads around the chateau were horrible to drive on. I missed a minibar/refrigerator.

column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column3: The Chateau was in a great location, all the staff were very friendly and spoke good English. Both the evening meal and breakfast were very nice and there was a good selection for both. Would happily visit again.

column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column3: The grounds, the feeling of quietness and freedom to walk around our relax on garden chairs scattered here and there.
column4: Swimming pool and spa area a bit overcrowded (it was a very hot weekend) but everywhere else very pleasant and quiet. Fantastic cafeteria terrace, but food pretty grim and overpriced.

column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column3: Hotel was really nice - the old castle was charming. Area was beautiful and peaceful.
column4: staff (one receptionist) was not very competent. I had feeling that they dont care about client and that they are not very flexible. I guess it is minus in all big hotels.

column2: Domaine de Ronchinne - Chateau et Ecuries
column3: Fantastic property and facilities, staff were super friendly.
column4: Our room didn't have a lot of natural light so it didn't really make us feel like spending much time there.
